posts.post_content: Most ogre cards are, obviously, flavored to be pretty brutish, but this one's insidious. Kuon's Essence embodies the flavor of black Kamigawa. Great for emasculating **[Creakwood Liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Creakwood Liege)** and the like.
posts.html:
Most ogre cards are, obviously, flavored to be pretty brutish, but this one's insidious. Kuon's Essence embodies the flavor of black Kamigawa. Great for emasculating Creakwood Liege and the like.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Tyrannopope (5/1/2011 8:51:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A cruel, cruel card, and makes for a vicious commander. Harder to get going than [The Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Abyss), but once he's flipped the effect is more powerful. Don't expect him to flip easily though, since once you summon him, every kill spell will be aimed at him. Best way to do it is to trigger him yourself with sac outlets.
posts.html:
A cruel, cruel card, and makes for a vicious commander. Harder to get going than The Abyss, but once he's flipped the effect is more powerful. Don't expect him to flip easily though, since once you summon him, every kill spell will be aimed at him. Best way to do it is to trigger him yourself with sac outlets.

posts.post_content:
When 3 creatures die in a turn, you turn it upside down and its other text becomes its abilities.  
  
Reminiscent of [The Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Abyss). I would think this card would be great for a deck full of sweepers, but if he dies too that's useless. He does survive [Infest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infest).
posts.html:

Reminiscent of The Abyss. I would think this card would be great for a deck full of sweepers, but if he dies too that's useless. He does survive Infest.

Posted By: AXER (12/10/2009 12:44:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The requirement for the trigger simply don't work that nicely with the flipped effect.  
  
[The Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Abyss) is that good because it simply means [Diabolic Edict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diabolic Edict) for your opponent each turn once it's cast without you being required to do anything else but not running (non-artifact) creatures.  
  
But by the time you manage to get three creatures into the graveyard in a single turn, you either did so with creatures on your side, which means that this effect will cost you creatures as well, or you won't need that effect any longer since you already hosed the battlefield anyways.  
  
It can still find some use though with recurring creatures like [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast), [Nether Traitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nether Traitor), or [Myr Servitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Servitor).  
  
Unfortunately the mana cost of this guy really asks for using this in a mono-colored deck.
posts.html:
The requirement for the trigger simply don't work that nicely with the flipped effect.

The Abyss is that good because it simply means Diabolic Edict for your opponent each turn once it's cast without you being required to do anything else but not running (non-artifact) creatures.

But by the time you manage to get three creatures into the graveyard in a single turn, you either did so with creatures on your side, which means that this effect will cost you creatures as well, or you won't need that effect any longer since you already hosed the battlefield anyways.

It can still find some use though with recurring creatures like Bloodghast, Nether Traitor, or Myr Servitor.

Unfortunately the mana cost of this guy really asks for using this in a mono-colored deck.
